segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in a puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the edge, spreading across the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it’s been like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on that plate, like nothing else exists.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a little worried for her—she’s going to slip if she doesn’t look down soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to something, but she’s totally oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t heard the water or noticed the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene feels almost surreal, like time has stopped.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that faucet before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
